result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon A Ball was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).
  • Disorderly Conduct. This is not a criminal offense and results only in a money penalty for this offense.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brandon A Ball

records.addlTxt:
Case Called: 11:03 am
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Ben Vechinski in person:
Defendant appears in person and with Atty Peter Prusinski in person;
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. State moves to:
Amend Count 1 to a County Ordinance DC pursuant to 9.21.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA: 
County DC >> GUILTY.
Ct. 2 (Operate Firearm While Intoxicated)>> GUILTY.
Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
County Ordinance DC >> $50 Forfeiture Plus Court Costs. Defendant has 30 Days to pay amount in full and if unable to do so, Defendant to set up a Payment Plan with the Clerk of Court's Office. 

Ct. 2 (Operate Firearm While Intoxicated)>> $100 Fine and Court Costs. Defendant has 30 Days to pay amount in full and if unable to do so, Defendant to set up a Payment Plan with the Clerk of Court's Office.

Adjourned: 11:15 am
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

- No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores, or Beer Tents. 
- Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol. 
- Prints and photograph.
